metadata.name: Schetsboek  #279
metadata.description:
This is my little tribute to fx (hash and fam).

During an important phone call, I was put on hold. Unconsciously, I began to scribble in my sketchbook. Research shows that scribbling helps focusing, but I dreamed away nonetheless until my pages were filled with scribbles, notes, shopping and a to-do list. 

Mint a uniquely generated page from my non-existent 100% coded sketchbook (except text typography). 

The page may contain many scribbles and drawings in pen, felt-tip pen, pencil, or less: often references to artists I admire, some in the form of loose scribbles, others in the form of riddles. Those drawings are drawn with code and vary. Unfortunately, I wasn‚Äôt able to incorporate tributes to all art and every artist I admire. The sketchbook would never finish. Thanks to rudxane I know that it‚Äôs ok to publish something unfinished ;-). 

One reference that appears in every token is to Sol Lewitt, an incredible source of inspiration. His artworks consist of instructions. Your sketch book pages contain instructions too. You will find the instructions for the artwork scribbled on your unique page by pressing i.

Curious how the work would look without the ‚Äòdistracting‚Äô scribbles and coffee stains? Press ‚Äòa‚Äô, ‚Äòw‚Äô, or ‚Äòg‚Äô. 

800 x 800 px

Press ‚Äòs‚Äô to save an image.

Made with p5js and the amazing p5.scribble.js library by Janneck Wullschleger.

Font used: Sacremento-Regular under the SIL Open Font License (OFL).

See license.md for the licenses of both.

Thank you all!

metadata.name: Forgotten Memories #27
metadata.description:
Memories can be dark or they can be bright. Sometimes they are faint and pale, sometimes they are vivid and colorful. Sometimes they are hard to forget, sometimes they are easy to remember.

Memories are easily interrupted or even fractured, but they are also mostly always connected with other memories, whether they are related or not.

Forgotten Memories is what I consider to be my most ambitious study of color harmony yet. Each color represents a different category of memory, which are stored in our mind in layers of time. Their shapes differ in width and length depending on how weak/strong the memory was and how long it lasted.

Once a memory is forgotten, it may or may never be remembered again. But one thing that is not to be forgotten is that whether we choose to forget or remember, we are made of our memories.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG.
Press 1 to save with 1000px height.
Press 2 to save with 2000px height.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: Cit√©s nuageuses #213
metadata.description:
Un de mes fr√®res s‚Äôest envol√© hier. Ou avant-hier, je ne sais plus. Il a vendu du lest pour sortir une fille. Une bourrasque soudaine les a emport√©s, lui et ses deux tickets de cin√©ma.

Cela fait bien trois semaines que nous n‚Äôavons pas eu de livraison. Pas de courrier non plus, par la m√™me occasion. J‚Äôen re√ßois rarement. Je n‚Äôai jamais re√ßu qu‚Äôune lettre, en r√©alit√©. C‚Äô√©tait une longue lettre √©pistolaire de mon ami Dino. Il est cowboy, dans une cit√© voisine. 

Mon fr√®re connaissait cette fille depuis bien cinq ou six ans. Il √©taient au coll√®ge ensemble. Il y avait encore des livraisons toutes les semaines, √† cette √©poque. Parfois deux fois par semaine. On pouvait vendre des enclumes et acheter du petit lest. Poids pour poids, on y perdait. Mais avec √ßa on arrivait quand m√™me √† vivre.

C‚Äô√©tait le temps o√π les rochers n‚Äô√©taient pas attach√©s. Ils d√©rivaient rarement, le vent n‚Äô√©tait pas si fort. Et ils √©taient plus denses aussi. Aujourd‚Äôhui, un rocher qui n‚Äôest pas en laisse ne sera plus l√† demain.

√Ä l‚Äô√©poque, j‚Äô√©tais moi-m√™me cowboy. Je vivais avec Jacques, un bon copain. Il n‚Äôy avait rien de sexuel entre nous. On gardait les rochers. Un soir, on jouait √† l‚Äôespagnolette, il m‚Äôa relanc√© de trois alors que j‚Äô√©tais atout tr√®fle. Vous imaginez la suite. Je ne l‚Äôai plus jamais revu apr√®s √ßa.

Plus personne ne va au coll√®ge. Mon fr√®re √©tait d‚Äôune des derni√®res g√©n√©rations. Apr√®s √ßa les gens ne voyaient plus l‚Äôint√©r√™t. Tout devient de plus en plus l√©ger, et apprendre √† lire ou √©crire ne p√®se rien. Plus on mine, plus on vends des enclumes, plus on peut acheter du lest. Mais comme le lest est plus cher que les enclumes, √† force, la cit√© devient de moins en moins lourde.

Le vent est de plus en plus fort aussi. Je pense que c‚Äôest pour √ßa qu‚Äôil y a moins de livraisons. Il y a de moins en moins de cit√©s qui arrivent √† rester suspendues. Celle de Dino s‚Äôest envol√©e l‚Äôann√©e derni√®re, Dino avec. Avec moins de cit√©s √† visiter par voyage, les livraisons sont moins rentables.

Avant d‚Äô√™tre cowboy je construisais des ponts. C‚Äôest comme √ßa que j‚Äôai appris √† lier les rochers. Plus personne ne le fait aujourd‚Äôhui. Il faut commencer par ancrer le rocher domestique. Et apr√®s, il faut attendre. C‚Äôest la partie la plus difficile. Personne n‚Äôa appris √† suffisamment attendre. Parce que plus le temps passe, plus on devient l√©gers. Mais c‚Äôest le plus important. Il faut attendre le que rocher sauvage devienne suffisamment l√©ger. Sinon, il emportera le rocher domestique avec lui et on aura tout perdu.

Je me demande pourquoi il a achet√© ces deux tickets de cin√©ma. C‚Äôest toujours le m√™me film qui passe. Je ne l‚Äôai jamais vu. √áa parle de dialectique et de ma√ßonnerie, il para√Æt. Le cin√©ma c‚Äôest un domaine que je trouve trop contraignant. Encore une id√©e de bureaucrate. Places assign√©es. Horaires fixes. Un processus administratif au profit de la structure sociale. Classique. Les bureaucrates commencent toujours par nous exploiter et ils finissent par nous ali√©ner. ‚ÄúServir le peuple‚Äù, ils appellent √ßa. 

Cela fait des ann√©es que le pont est de moins en moins solide. De toutes les fa√ßons, on n‚Äôa rien pour le r√©parer. Nos rochers sont domestiqu√©s depuis le temps, mais ils s‚Äôentrainent les uns les autres au lieu de se stabiliser. La suspension des cit√©s, √ßa a l‚Äôair simple mais √ßa ne l‚Äôest pas vraiment. Quand elles ont √©t√© construites, avec les machines-outils des livreurs, elles √©taient bien suspendues. Mais peu √† peu, elles se sont d√©grad√©es. La seule richesse des cit√©s, c‚Äôest leur gravit√©. Pourquoi r√©parer ce qui est destin√© √† s‚Äôenvoler ?

Je comprends pourquoi mon fr√®re a vendu du lest. Apr√®s tout, le lest est l√† pour √™tre vendu tant qu‚Äôil vaut encore quelque chose. Jeudi dernier, le pont est tomb√©. Notre deuxi√®me rocher majeur est toujours reli√© par la chaine des rochers mineurs, mais elle ne va pas tenir longtemps. La cit√© va s‚Äôenvoler bient√¥t. Peut-√™tre demain ou apr√®s-demain. Je vous laisse, je dois aller miner.

attributes.name: Nombre de pi√®ces dans ma collection ?
attributes.value: En partant du d√©but ou de la fin ?

attributes.name: Nombre de travers de porcs sel-poivre √† commander pour midi ?
attributes.value: Les jours pairs ou les jours impairs?

attributes.name: Nombre de b√¢timents ?
attributes.value: Demandez aux autorit√©s concern√©es, moi je n'y suis pour rien.

attributes.name: Nombre d'hippopotames ?
attributes.value: Mon chacal hollandais s'appelait Vital. C'est un nom tr√®s courant l√†-bas.

attributes.name: Nombre de poneys ?
attributes.value: Quand il fait beau ou quand il pleut ?

attributes.name: Nombre de m√®tres cubes d'enclumes disponibles dans ce d√©partement ?
attributes.value: Mon chacal hollandais s'appelait Vital. C'est un nom tr√®s courant l√†-bas.

attributes.name: Nombre de syst√®mes types automates cellulaires ?
Nombre de jours dans une ann√©e ?
Nombre de chevaux ?
attributes.value: C'est une vraie question. Je me souviens de ces longues soir√©es d'√©t√©, √† l'ombre des peupliers en fleurs. √Ä l'√©poque j'avais un adopt√© un chacal hollandais. Il √©tait sp√©cialis√© dans les ench√®res. Nous partagions quelques croquettes en regardant le vent secouer les nuages. Mais vous connaissez d√©j√† cette histoire, je me r√©p√®te.

metadata.name: looking through a glass #5
metadata.description:
or life is a colorful mess
or not your usual generative forest

this art project continues the path that 'life is a (beautiful) mess' began with the representation of our lives using drawing lines that make repetitive patterns
as life develops, we look at it through the glass of our unique existence. every event, emotion and thought we experience stain our personal glass and conditions our regard towards the world that surrounds us
the cercles in every composition, represents that glass that we all have between us and the world, and the movement of the lines under it, life developing as we observe it
or it's just another figurative generative art project, as you wish...

10 different palettes
over 30 different color pens
single or multiple color glasses or cercles option
press [1], [2], [3], [4] keys to multiply resolution and reload the piece
press [s] to capture an image .png
press [r] to reload the animation
click the mouse to stop the drawing
doubleclick the mouse to resume the drawing

generative art created by mehno using p5js

metadata.name: Pillars of Tomorrow #47
metadata.description:
Our vision is to create meaningful generative artworks that express human sentiments about their social experiences.

We‚Äôre currently focused on experiences centered around celebration, and we‚Äôve chosen a theme that connects people through music.
Music has the power to evoke a wide range of emotions within us, especially when experienced through a collective experience.

We wanted to generate an artistic script that visually captures these expressions. 

Our first music NFT collection reflects human sentiments towards Tomorrowland 2022. 
It's a creative collaboration with dahleea, an artist dedicated to colors, who gave us the inspiration for the visuals you are seeing through one of her beautiful and colorful artworks.

Coding, music, and art collide to recreate emotions expressed by people coming together from all over the world to share music and connection at one of the world‚Äôs leading music festivals. 

The creative process:

Data was collected via emotion analysis using Twitter‚Äôs API. Our data is derived from emotion analysis models to extract the emotion scores (Happiness, Anger, Sadness, Fear, and Surprise) from 105,762 tweets, written in English, and containing mention of ‚ÄòTomorrowland' between July 15, 2022, to August 8, 2022. 

Our analysis demonstrated the following emotions:

Happiness: 38%
Anger 8%
Sadness: 26%
Fear: 28%

Music:

In Pillars of Tomorrow, there are 4 instruments: bass, piano, percussion (hi-hat, kick, snare, claps, fx sounds), and a quiet pad. All the rhythms are self-written using Ableton, exported, and randomly selected to create the backbone of our generative music NFT.

This music piece has 4 different parts (basic, drop, break, after-drop) which are looped 3 times. All parts include different rhythm variations which are chosen randomly.¬†

The generative harmony is present in the basic and after-drop parts. The key to generating harmony is using the emotion percentages above as possibilities for the next piano chord and melody to sound happy or sad.‚Ä® 
We chose to distort our bass sound according to anger trait values, as distortion can turn a mild bass into an aggressive one.¬†

Finally, there is also an emotion of surprise, which is associated with a special background and the sound of bells ringing. ‚Ä®The surprise element trait of the mints will be revealed after the Pillars of Tomorrow collection is fully minted.

We wanted to make a dynamic collection that would give you the feeling of a live music event, an interactive experience. A big stage flowing with music and diverse human expressions.

c-camera start/stop
p pause (or play)

space (play/stop)

l (change where the camera look)

Arrow Up (View pillars from above)
Arrow down (go to starting position)
Arrow left/right (camera moving direction)

AWSD work as arrows as well
scroll (Zoom In/Out)

enter (screenshot)

For an optimal experience, we recommend using Google Chrome.

#CodingIsArt

metadata.name: Apparenza #98
metadata.description:
Apparenza is just the surface of an inner world, of an inner emotional status.
Apparenza sometimes does not represent reality, sometimes it resembles it.

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

@AlfredoBoaron

metadata.name: Growth v02 #439
metadata.description:
Growth patterns, version 2. January 2022
Edition of 512

Growth v02 is an generative exploration of patterns in the style of William Morris' iconic wallpaper designs from the 1800s. The code for the Growth series was originally designed to create plausible road networks but has been rewritten to create more organic curved forms. Created with p5js.

'space' to pause the simulation
'h' to toggle to higher res (increases canvas size but runs slower: great for screengrabs)
'r' to reset the seed (some features are locked to the original hash)
's' to save an image to disk
All generated patterns are tile-able horizontally and vertically.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

This project relies heavily on randomly generated values. It has been thoroughly tested. However, there is always the chance that the wrong combination of randomness can create less-compelling growth. If you feel you version is not living up to the potential promised with this piece, please email me.

metadata.name: Holy Mountain #18
metadata.description:
Mountains throughout human history have taken on deep meanings. Coated with immense sacredness by all peoples in the most different places. Being them as a representation of God himself or being the object of worship. For many the mountains were the very abode of the Gods. They are in the collective unconscious as the ability to connect men and gods, through the flow of energy between earth and heaven.

The symbology is very strong. It unconsciously reminds us of the process of encounter between the loneliness of the earth and the hope of the sky, between the fog that blinds and the cloud that supports, between the abyss of the ground and the proximity of the stars. All this is very charming and fascinating.

All human beings have their own mountain, which demands from each one their limits to reach the top, the desire for the breathtaking view, the fear of falling, but also the hope of the last step at the highest point.

In generative art it couldn't be different, going through all the learning, from its fundamentals, to all the countless hours of tests, to countless moments of problem solving and research and more research. This whole process is without a doubt like climbing a mountain. Thinking about the project is exactly like looking at a mountain and imagining how exhausting it will be all the way to conquer it. Finishing your work is like breathing a sigh of relief, looking down and seeing how hard it was to get there, but at the same time looking ahead and realizing how rewarding it was to be able to have that vision and breathe the refreshing breeze of the moment.

After going through a transformation in my first work, where I transmuted my artistic essence from illustration to generative art. Now I come to this second work that I delved into, and after months of climbing this mountain of mine, I give it to you.


- Press "S" in live view mode after loading to save at 1600x1600px.

license: 
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

project website:
https://playman.me/projectmountain

metadata.name: Part:Counterpart #143
metadata.description:
'Part:Counterpart' is an experiment in form, disintegration, and context. Each work is created within one of three modes, Part, Counterpart, or Part:Counterpart.

In experimenting, I've enjoyed taking a simple composition and breaking it down with various methods. This transforms the original composition into something new, but it also begins to lose what the original had to say. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, and I want to dive a little deeper and explore ideas as a sort of tangible substance. Already we're comparing ideas against their translations and evolutions, but what happens if we present them both within the context of the other?

Additionally, what if we present both of these ideas with echoes and tangents, discussion around the ideas and their practical applications instead of imagined? Sure, these aren't our idea, or even our translation, but they exist only because the originals do.

How does this change our opinion of the original? Is every idea destined to be picked apart and reimagined forever until it bears only a faint resemblance? Where is the line between our Counterpart and an echo?

This piece hopes to inspire contemplation on the nature of storytelling and artistic inspiration.

10% of ideas are encrypted to obscure the original Part.
Press ‚Äôs‚Äô to save a 3600x4500 png.
Press ‚Äòp‚Äô to save the original Part, pure and untouched.

metadata.name: Holy Mountain #133
metadata.description:
Mountains throughout human history have taken on deep meanings. Coated with immense sacredness by all peoples in the most different places. Being them as a representation of God himself or being the object of worship. For many the mountains were the very abode of the Gods. They are in the collective unconscious as the ability to connect men and gods, through the flow of energy between earth and heaven.

The symbology is very strong. It unconsciously reminds us of the process of encounter between the loneliness of the earth and the hope of the sky, between the fog that blinds and the cloud that supports, between the abyss of the ground and the proximity of the stars. All this is very charming and fascinating.

All human beings have their own mountain, which demands from each one their limits to reach the top, the desire for the breathtaking view, the fear of falling, but also the hope of the last step at the highest point.

In generative art it couldn't be different, going through all the learning, from its fundamentals, to all the countless hours of tests, to countless moments of problem solving and research and more research. This whole process is without a doubt like climbing a mountain. Thinking about the project is exactly like looking at a mountain and imagining how exhausting it will be all the way to conquer it. Finishing your work is like breathing a sigh of relief, looking down and seeing how hard it was to get there, but at the same time looking ahead and realizing how rewarding it was to be able to have that vision and breathe the refreshing breeze of the moment.

After going through a transformation in my first work, where I transmuted my artistic essence from illustration to generative art. Now I come to this second work that I delved into, and after months of climbing this mountain of mine, I give it to you.


- Press "S" in live view mode after loading to save at 1600x1600px.

license: 
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

project website:
https://playman.me/projectmountain

metadata.name: InBloom #157
metadata.description:
We are experiencing our blooming at different ages of life. 

Five particular stages of life (aha moments?) were captured in these aesthetic codes.

stage 1 : ME : self-realization
Started as a single cell(spot) on the stage. By the power of time and experience. We grow and emerge into a bigger self that has unique flaws/beauty. In this stage, we should spend most of our time loving and hating ourselves. It is the privilege of being young.

This stage is all about abusing your YOUTH.

stage 2 : Walk : Appreciate your path
The future is so scary and vague because of its unpredictable nature. Despite blind guessing the upcoming moves, we can study and appreciate our own path and locus. Through this practice, we can find out whether should we follow the locus or should we break the bondage.

This stage is about embracing your CHOICES.

stage 3 : MeetsTheEnd : The you and you in different time
At one moment in life. We start wearing masks and felt pain and frustrated for not being original. One day we will gather all of the personas and formed a circle.

Every version of me confronted each other and start to be a new harmony instead of self conflicts.

This stage is about MATURE.

stage 4 : Reflection : Know Your Enemy
Someone is like a clone of you. The degree of similarity makes you generate two extreme feelings towards this person. 

You loved/hated this person very much at the same time. And spend a lot of energy dealing with these bipolar emotions. Instead of sticking to this emotional glue for years, you finally leave this perspective and enter a new way of thinking.

‚ÄúCo-exist‚Äù may be far better than ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù.

This stage is about DISTANCE AND ACCEPTANCE.

stage 5 : Uprising : Grow With Your Surrounding
Life indeed is a mix of guilt/imperfection/flaw/mistakes and an ever-going path correcting process. 

Success in life is not a constant but a calculus formula.

Instead of being CLEVER. You learnt to be WISE.

This stage is about NULL.

About The Visual Presentation 
Using micro-structure of petals and other floral parts, with a macro algorithm to form geometric arrangements such as center/sinusoidal/circular/opposite/vertical composition to narrate the above 5 stages of life.

About The Music
Two pieces of music were placed in the work and suggest you experience the work with the music played alongside. 

Song one [The Call] mellow piano-bell generates different callings in our life. We as the sound traveled in time from subjective view to objective one by merging with other sound elements in our life.

Song II is more direct, with chords on guitar using Nirvana [In Bloom] as a blueprint, messing around with back and forward power chords on the fingerboard like a life-researcher that traveling his own timeline and attempt to seek wisdom inside this trip.

We never arrive and stop at BLOOM, instead, we are IN BLOOM.

// BEST VIEW IN NEW WINDOW
// S > SAVE
// B > BLOOM in same stage with variations
// M > Music On/Off

metadata.name: diamond gate #22
metadata.description:
second #gate artwork
The lines create a whole "plan of the city", and then gradually fill it in creating the effect of diamonds. From afar, the artwork looks like computer boards or ancient drawings.

metadata.name: InBloom #179
metadata.description:
We are experiencing our blooming at different ages of life. 

Five particular stages of life (aha moments?) were captured in these aesthetic codes.

stage 1 : ME : self-realization
Started as a single cell(spot) on the stage. By the power of time and experience. We grow and emerge into a bigger self that has unique flaws/beauty. In this stage, we should spend most of our time loving and hating ourselves. It is the privilege of being young.

This stage is all about abusing your YOUTH.

stage 2 : Walk : Appreciate your path
The future is so scary and vague because of its unpredictable nature. Despite blind guessing the upcoming moves, we can study and appreciate our own path and locus. Through this practice, we can find out whether should we follow the locus or should we break the bondage.

This stage is about embracing your CHOICES.

stage 3 : MeetsTheEnd : The you and you in different time
At one moment in life. We start wearing masks and felt pain and frustrated for not being original. One day we will gather all of the personas and formed a circle.

Every version of me confronted each other and start to be a new harmony instead of self conflicts.

This stage is about MATURE.

stage 4 : Reflection : Know Your Enemy
Someone is like a clone of you. The degree of similarity makes you generate two extreme feelings towards this person. 

You loved/hated this person very much at the same time. And spend a lot of energy dealing with these bipolar emotions. Instead of sticking to this emotional glue for years, you finally leave this perspective and enter a new way of thinking.

‚ÄúCo-exist‚Äù may be far better than ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù.

This stage is about DISTANCE AND ACCEPTANCE.

stage 5 : Uprising : Grow With Your Surrounding
Life indeed is a mix of guilt/imperfection/flaw/mistakes and an ever-going path correcting process. 

Success in life is not a constant but a calculus formula.

Instead of being CLEVER. You learnt to be WISE.

This stage is about NULL.

About The Visual Presentation 
Using micro-structure of petals and other floral parts, with a macro algorithm to form geometric arrangements such as center/sinusoidal/circular/opposite/vertical composition to narrate the above 5 stages of life.

About The Music
Two pieces of music were placed in the work and suggest you experience the work with the music played alongside. 

Song one [The Call] mellow piano-bell generates different callings in our life. We as the sound traveled in time from subjective view to objective one by merging with other sound elements in our life.

Song II is more direct, with chords on guitar using Nirvana [In Bloom] as a blueprint, messing around with back and forward power chords on the fingerboard like a life-researcher that traveling his own timeline and attempt to seek wisdom inside this trip.

We never arrive and stop at BLOOM, instead, we are IN BLOOM.

metadata.name: Ramble #70
metadata.description:
ram‚Ä¢ble - talk or write at length in a confused or inconsequential way / a walk taken for pleasure in the countryside

Ramble is narrative artwork about a life (or lives). From a single observation to a long history. Part prose part painting. After a time the letters of the narrative slowly cover with tiny abstract landscapes. They are the type of landscape painting you would paint on a postage stamp. As the size of the narrative grows it becomes harder and harder to read all the letters before they are covered. Eventually when all the letters are covered the landscapes are walked over and scratched. There is no trace of what was there to start.

Technical / Artistic

The prose is built around a slotted algorithm that builds sentences always starting with a universal pronoun. It then splits and randomizes the lines and fills the allotted grid space it is given. The build up of sentences creates a sort of character study or life.

The landscapes are a set of very simple rolling shapes with texture applied, they stick to a predefined color scheme chosen by the hash. They remind me of tissue paper stained glass kids make in kindergarten.

The scratches are just that, scratches or shapes that bleed through to the background. They serve to flatten and wipe away, chair scratches on a ballroom floor or bird footprints in sand.

---

Scaling the image up or down will yield slightly different final outputs. I prefer the 10:9 view ratio. Right click to save image. 

Just code (Javascript, no frameworks or dependencies).
Made by DSims (dillansimmons.com)
https://objkt.com/profile/tz1Q4YfANpgKAuPXd1fobzBzdjg6wtPmmw5m/created

attributes.name: Prose
attributes.value: She tried to stay busy but corporate culture got to her. She became excited by sloths.

metadata.name: Bloom in the rain #85
metadata.description:
In the oriental ink and wash paintings, the plain nature and the poetic charm are admired. The seemingly lonely scenery can often reflect the noble sentiment of the literati. In this work, I create a poetic, raining scenery by p5.js. I also reproduce the ink rhythm and texture strokes pattern left by the brush on the rice paper. This is my preliminary exploration of generative art with the form and style of oriental aesthetics.

Created purely with p5.js.
For best result, open in live view 
and press [s] to save a png

Features:
1)	pallete: whiteBackground | darkBackground | color ink
2)	rock position: left | center | right 
3)	number of tree: one | two | three
4)	rain: none | drizzle | shower | heavy | extremely heavy
5)	background type: mountain | ocean 
6)	composition: horizontal_long | horizontal | square
7)	invert color: true | false
8)	moon type: full | slender

This is an original work created by Pingyeh Li, Sep 2022.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/ - @Pingyeh Li

metadata.name: Fractal in the words #44
metadata.description:
Tribute to Herbert W. Franke.

Fractal based on mathematics is placed in Japanese words.

Color Pallet has 10 variations.
Draw Color has 2 variations.
Background Color has 4 variations.

Controls (in live view):
- Press [f] to switch full screen on and off
- Press [s] to download a PNG file with windowsize
- Press [l] to download a PNG file with large size 4000 pixel (wait a minutes)

Create with p5.js
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
